bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 62 (Monday, April 12, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NEWMAN:H.R. 2450.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 1 of Section 8 of Article I of the Unuited StatesConstitution[Page H1727]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: This bill exempts taxpayers whose modified adjusted gross income does not exceed $400,000 in a taxable year from the 80% taxable income limit on net operating loss carryovers.

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to except certain individuals from the 80 percent taxable income limitation on net operating loss carryovers.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to except certain individuals from the 80 percent taxable income limitation on net operating loss carryovers.
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to except certain individuals from the 80 percent taxable income limitation on net operating loss carryovers.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
